content.description: the blocky arete just L of the cave, leads into a short corner. Leave the safety of a ledge to tackle the awkward slabby dihedral above. Dont be tempted to stray too far left and away from the bolts when leaving the ledge, its harder, dirty and has no holds, it will hurt you! If you dont like slabs, avoid..

Progressively more difficult climbing up tufas and big pocke. Last third of route is significantly harder than the first bit. The crux can be pulled in a powerful direct fashion or a more technical rightward option. Amazing climbing on good stone.
content.location: The farthest left route on the Main Wall Proper.

content.description:
Bored and looking for something new? Want to be a chad and monopolize every climb on the wall? Look no further!

Clip the first 2 bolts of PMS (i recommend long draw on second bolt). Traverse immediately to left and clip 3rd and 4th bolt of Fashion Victim (use alpine draw on 3rd bolt). Clip obvious bolt on The Squeeze and clip the final bolt on Crank and Space Sluts. Finish on the upper crux of space sluts and clip the anchors under the tree. All-in-all a good time.

Be careful cleaning. You will probably have to re-climb the route. Don't swing off the wall and crash into the chastity belt pillar.
content.location: Starts under PMS and finishes on Space Sluts anchor.

content.description: A short jug haul to a mungy, steep crack. Really nice finger locks to a perfect hand jam rest, then prepare to do battle with the bouldery crux. The last fifteen feet are v3/4ish. A very rad climb.
content.location: Shares the first three bolts with Crank Whore, then follows the crack left for another two bolts and eventually diagonals back right to an anchor just under the large pine.

content.description: from the staple on pancake day, continue direct via some fierce pocket pulling to a flat edge, bolt, after which move left to the arete and finishing groove of Tigers Reach. F7c
content.protection: 8x glue in bolts and Fixe chains

content.description:
from the start of spread eagle, continue direct thru a fierce v6 bulge. Follow some huecos to join No 1/4 at the hard bit (at the small overlap)  F7b+/c?

PLEASE DONT CLIMB THIS FROM FEBUARY TO JUNE (OR POST FLEDGING) AS SWALLOWS ARE IN THE POCKETS , AND THEY ARE BEAUTIFUL
Start on PMS then move left through cool moves into Fashion Victim.
Thin and sharp the entire route, with a drilled mono through a blank section.
content.protection: 6 bolts. A new 2 bolt anchor has been established 2014, but the old anchor bolts are still there. Be sure to clip the newer ones
content.location: This route is located on the Main Wall between Fashion Victim and Love Muffin

content.description:
climb direct off the tree trunk to join spread eagle for one bolt then traverse left along the crimp line to a rockover move at the pancake, without hesitation aim for the letterbox above and an ok rest. From the staple escape left to the arete and into the groove, clipping one more bolt along the way (same finish as Tigers Reach)

F7b/+
content.protection: 7x glued in (with A7) 3/8" x 6" Fixe bolts to Fixe chains -(2x 12mm powers, 5piece expansion bolts)
content.location: the fixe gluein line at the far left of main wall at the entrance to the cave. Starting off a felled tree.

content.description: New direct start is just left of Crank Whore/Space Sluts start.  Follow new bolts diagnally left and upwards to the finish at the Spread Eagle anchors.
content.protection: 6 New Fixe Stainless Steel glue-ins with A7 Epoxy. Shares an anchor with Spread Eagle and has 2 fixed caribiners on chains for the lower off.
content.location: This route is located between Spread Eagle and Space Sluts.

content.description: Good edges lead up to a blank headwall. Clipping the 3rd bolt is a bit strenuous. The crux is the blankness guarding the chains, from a poor crimp and a pretty good left hand either dyno or levitate. Very fun route
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with fixed carabiners for lower off
content.location: The second route from the far right of the cliff, to the right of PMS and the left of Beds, or two bolts lines to the right of Fashion Victim.

content.protection: 4x Fixe 3.5" glueins, to fixe staple and 3.5" anchor
content.location: Far R of main wall, on the slabby aspect. (L of the scramble to get to the top of mainwall to set up TR etc.)

content.description: Another great route! This is a pure stamina route, no real cruxes! In my honest opinion, I don't think this route is any harder than Crank Whore, however I hesitate to drop two letter grades from its original rating.
content.protection: 6 Bolts; 2 Bolt Anchor w/ Lower Offâ€™s
content.location: The route directly to the right of Crank Whore, begins just right of a bush on jugs to a high first bolt. Bolts with chains for an anchor

content.description:
The route begins on Crank Whore. Climb Crank Whore to the 4th bolt using a longer draw to avoid rope drag  Then traverse right  across the route The Squeeze using a right hand gaston to join the route Fashion Victim at its 4th bolt. Make the clip with a longer draw if you have one to avoid rope drag. Continue to the top of Fashion Victim.

This route avoids the smaller crimps on the upper section of Crank Whore and the crimps on the lower section of Fashion Victim, combining the bigger jugs on both routes and makes a great warm up route for the Main Walls harder routes.
The crux is between the last bolt and the anchor.  Originally rated 5.11d, however several holds have broken off bumping the grade to a firm 5.12b/c.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: Furthest route on the right on the Main Wall, right of Love Muffin.  Lower off the chains.

content.description: The most popular route on the Main Wall. Follow the line of XL jugs up until the bolt line splits, follow the jugs to the right. The crux can be pulled multiple ways but involves the right hand undercling, high feet, and a toss, the true crux is just being fresh for the crux, as the move is probably only v0+.
content.location: This route is located about dead center of the main wall, directly under the obvious owl-hole flake midway up the wall. The anchor is 10 feet right of the large pine on the top of the wall, with obvious long chains hanging off
